item.title: Debora add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Debora add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Debora add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Debora add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Debora add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "If you care about something you have to protect it – If you’re lucky enough to find a way of life you love, you have to find the courage to live it." -- John Irving

item.title: Debora add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Your memory is a monster; you forget—it doesn't. It simply files things away. It keeps things for you, or hides things from you—and summons them to your recall with will of its own. You think you have a memory; but it has you!" -- John Irving

item.title: Debora add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "If you once forfeit the confidence of your fellow citizens, you can never regain their respect and esteem. It is true that you may fool all of the people some of the time; you can even fool some of the people all of the time; but you can't fool all of the people all of the time. -Speech at Clinton, Illinois, September 8, 1854." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Debora add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Debora add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "Grief is a most peculiar thing; we’re so helpless in the face of it. It’s like a window that will simply open of its own accord. The room grows cold, and we can do nothing but shiver. But it opens a little less each time, and a little less; and one day we wonder what has become of it." -- Arthur Golden

item.title: Debora add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "A child can teach an adult three things: to be happy for no reason, to always be busy with something, and to know how to demand with all his might that which he desires." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Debora add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you liked being a teenager, there's something really wrong with you." -- Stephen King

item.title: Debora add a quote by Emma Donoghue
item.description: "Scared is what you're feeling. Brave is what you're doing." -- Emma Donoghue

item.title: Debora add a quote by Emma Donoghue
item.description: "Stories are a different kind of true." -- Emma Donoghue

item.title: Debora add a quote by Emma Donoghue
item.description: "It’s called mind over matter. If we don’t mind, it doesn’t matter." -- Emma Donoghue

item.title: Debora add a quote by Emma Donoghue
item.description: "Books are the air I breathe, so I don't notice the seasons." -- Emma Donoghue

item.title: Debora add a quote by Emily Giffin
item.description: "A son is a son 'til he gets a wife, but a daughter is a daughter all her life. " -- Emily Giffin

item.title: Debora add a quote by Jennifer Donnelly
item.description: "Right now I want a word that describes the feeling that you get--a cold sick feeling, deep down inside--when you know something is happening that will change you, and you don't want it to, but you can't stop it. And you know, for the first time, for the very first time, that there will now be a <i>before</i> and an <i>after</i>, a <i>was</i> and a <i>will be</i>. And that you will never again quite be the same person you were." -- Jennifer Donnelly

item.title: Debora add a quote by Jennifer Donnelly
item.description: "There were lives in those books, and deaths. Families and friends and lovers and enemies. Joy and despair, jealousy, envy, madness, and rage. All there. I reached out and touched the cover of one called <i>The Earth</i>. I could almost hear the characters inside, murmuring and jostling, impatient for me to open the cover and let them out." -- Jennifer Donnelly
